channel.title: JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [IP-94793] RIS Prefetch: Add LessThan and GreaterThan to the GUI dropdown box.
item.description:
The RIS prefetch admin page is missing two new operators:

  • LessThan
  • GreaterThan

These two were newly added for the PatientSearch API.
item.summary: RIS Prefetch: Add LessThan and GreaterThan to the GUI dropdown box.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [IP-94352] RIS Prefetching tests fail when DMS is in postgres mode (Cont..)

The test logs simply show a timeout error.

TestId_DM_C3040249 using SQL: SELECT ParentTestId, QueryTable, WhereClause FROM RelevantConditions WHERE (ParentTestId = 'TestId_DM_C3040249')  AND (QueryTable = 'DicomExtern')
[2018-07-30 10:03:08.303 RISPFD mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG) {19857}] Checking to see if the message handler was called
[2018-07-30 10:03:08.303 RISPFD mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {19857}] (prefetchRelevantDicomExternStudies) No DicomExtern relevant conditions found for Rule TestId_DM_C3040249. DicomExtern wil
l not be queried.
[2018-07-30 10:03:08.303 RISPFD mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {19857}] (RISPFd-main) Marking request with PatientId=C3040249PID9A7SEZKL6IBFYPY1VYN7JYJOEHKK1DY8XEL21FK9EAI and StudyDateTime=2018
0730050049 as processed.[1] tests matched the prefetching request.
I beleive that RisPrefetchAdmin beleives that we are in Sybase Mode and looks at the RelevantConditions table instead of the new postgres schema.

Confirmed. After commenting out the rule deletion code, I found this in the db:

sybdump RisPreFetch RelevantConditions -v
 1 ParentTestId .....................[TestId_DM_C252940]
 2 QueryTable .......................[SeriesLevel]
 3 WhereClause ......................[Mod = 'CT']

RisPrefetchAdmin is still writing the old Sybase-style relevant conditions.
Is it possible that the integration test is sending the old style instead of the new style?

Fixed the integration testing driver that sends prefetching rules to send conditions instead of where clauses.

Current Status:
TestRisPrefetchMultipleRules
TestRisPrefetchRules
TestRisPrefetchRulesFilter
TestParallelRisPrefetch
TestCandidatePatientPrefetching
TestRisPrefetch

The DicomExtern ones are failing because DicomAgent can't connect back to the the test runner. Will run on jenkins.

item.title: [IP-94491] Remove remaining references to DICOMMASTER DB after migration

For safety and to make sure that we have not forgotten any applications that directly invoke DicomMaster, we should remove most references to DicomMaster.

Cases:

  1. Using this DB section to read MDB's hostname and connect to hessian
    1. Should be renamed to DATABASE_GLOBALDICOM
  2. Using this DB section to directly connect to the DB and invoke a stored procedure
    1. OK, must remain
  3. Using this DB section to directly connect and query the schema
    1. Log a bug and this application needs to be addressed before the release of PACS-4-17-1

item.title: [IP-86957] Modify RisPrefetchAdmin servlet to no longer access the DicomMaster sybase DBMS directly
item.description:
Acceptance Criteria

  • RisPrefetchAdmin servlet functionality shall be unchanged
  • all direct database access will be removed
  • RisPrefetchAdmin servlet will invoke one of DicomMaster's supported protocols for getting any information from the DicomMaster database.

Non-functional Acceptance Criteria

  • all database components will be removed from RisPrefetchAdmin servlet

Summary

  • Calls CheckWhereClause when a new Where Clause is created in the RisPrefetching page

To test in InteleBrowser
PACS Configuration
-RIS Prefetching

  • Enter a where clause and click 'Create New PreFetching Rule'

item.title: [IP-94212] RisPrefetch: Creating new condition using BodyPartMatch causes error
item.description:
Attempting to create a RIS Prefetch condition using Body Part Matching causes an IndexOutOfBoundsException upon save. This is because no value is sent as part of the submission and the parsing code always expects a value to be present.

item.title: [IP-90447] AutoPull/SeriesMover: RisPrefetching test cases failing on A74 (passed on A72) (regression)
item.description:
RPM Version

Install AutoPull-4.16.2.A74-ims01.i386

Minimal steps to reproduce

1. Install AutoPull-4.16.2.A72-ims01.i386
2. Run automated test case (TestRisPrefetchDicomExtern)TRC:322885 (or any of the ones that are recently failing on trunk because of Ris Prefetching)
3. Install AutoPull-4.16.2.A74-ims01.i386
4. Run automated test case TRC:322885

Expected behaviour

Test passed on both

What happened instead?

Test passes on A72
Test fails on A74

Explanation

RisPrefetching test cases makes use of RISPFd that summons AutoPull to fetch series.

AutoPull is affected by SeriesMover changes because of this bug:
IP-64977 - AutoPull: link with SeriesMover library directly instead of invoking it via HTTP, to avoid timeouts / 502 errors
-------

Using Compare releases, we see several bugs that have a direct impact on SeriesMover:
https://buildweb.intelerad.com/compare_releases/intelepacs/build/PACS-4-16-2-A72/build/PACS-4-16-2-A74/false/false/false

IP-86967 Convert to DMS API invocations ( Worked by Emil Belardo (Backend Raptors) )

IP-87273 Merge devel branch to forge ( Worked by Emil Belardo (Backend Raptors) )

IP-89499 As a developer I want the SeriesMoverServlet use the information from network.cfg to resolve the AETitles hostname to IP in the case of the toggle is enabled. ( Worked by Brian Leung (Scrum Team #1) )

I'm inclined to think that IP-89499 could be the culprit introducing the regression, but I'm not 100% certain.

Other notes:
You might have to set the following key first to avoid time constraint issues:

[RisPrefetch]
TIME_LIMIT_PAST_HOURS = 12
----------

The following test cases are affected:

TwoServer_Default:risprefetch.TestCandidatePatientPrefetching.testDicomExtern_maxPriorsToPrefetchIsReachedExcludingSameDay:C3850690
TwoServer_Default:risprefetch.TestCandidatePatientPrefetching.testDicomMasterAndDicomExtern_prefetchPriors:C3742820
TwoServer_Default:risprefetch.TestCandidatePatientPrefetching.testDicomExtern_maxPriorsToPrefetchIsReached:C3850689
TwoServer_Default:risprefetch.TestCandidatePatientPrefetching.testDicomExtern_prefetchPriorsAboveEqualAndBelowConfidenceLevel:C3742815
TwoServer_Default:risprefetch.TestRisPrefetchMultipleRules.testMultipleRisPrefetchRules:C4284

-------

The problem is that the SeriesMoverLobrary was changed to invoke DMS instead of directly DicomMaster database.

Unfortunately, the logic has changed in the following 2 lines in SeriesFinder.loadBaseInformation():

            mSeriesUids = mSeriesInformationService.getSeriesForStudyUid( mStudyUid );
            mDicomMasterQuery.getSeriesListForSeriesInstanceUidList( mSeriesUids );

When SQL was used, the seriesUids list was empty because DicomMaster did not find this study.
And the next SQL queried information for the given empty list of seriesUids.
This worked in SQL because sybase simply returned nothing, but the new hessian call throws an exception when the argument is an empty list.

item.title: [IP-97670] HL7GS Order Termination Fails at end of 31 day month with order with YYYYMM requested date time that should be excluded
item.description:
colored textSee automation bug: IP-84121

Scenario

  • HL7GS order termination is enabled at the site
  • The client has the start of the inclusive age range at 30 days
  • It is the last day of the month
  • There is at least one order with an obr.requested_date_time in YYYYMM format on the last day of the month (ex "201901")

Expected results

  • The order is excluded from order termination and is not deleted

Actual results

  • The order is processed by order termination and is deleted

Notes

  • I've attached a patch that makes it possible to reproduce this bug in a unit test
  • This seems like an edge case, and we need to think about whether this is worth the complexity in fixing this
  • Complexity in this case means SQL that can process conditional logic so we get the new result we want without compromising the existing correct behaviour
  • From running a new set of unit tests, this is the current behaviour:
Jan 30th:
------
requestedDateTime of excluded: 201901
inclusiveRange: 20160505(1000), 20181231(30)

Jan 31st:  (FAILED AUTOMATION!!!!!!!)
------
requestedDateTime of excluded: 201901
inclusiveRange: 20160506(1000), 20190101(30)

Feb 1st:
------
requestedDateTime of excluded: 201902
inclusiveRange: 20160507(1000), 20190102(30)
  • The logic can also be simulated with a simple table definition, a couple of records, and some simple SQL:
CREATE table req_date_time (
   PLACER_FIELD_1   varchar(60),
   REQUESTED_DATE_TIME   varchar(26) NULL
);


insert into req_date_time values ('ACC1', '201901');
insert into req_date_time values ('ACC2', '201902');

select *
FROM req_date_time
WHERE requested_date_time <= '20181231';


select *
FROM req_date_time
WHERE requested_date_time <= '20190101';


select *
FROM req_date_time
WHERE requested_date_time <= '20190102';
  • Here is the configuration that results in the failure.
[Hl7GatewayServer-OrderTerminationPolicy.Default]
policyModuleClass                                = com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.statusesExisting = CM,IP,ZA
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.ageRangeExclusive = 180:360
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.maxOrdersToTerminate = 5
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.ageRangeInclusiveInDays = 30:1000
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.modalities = MR,US
orderTerminationEnabled                          = false
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.sendingFacilities = Intelerad,McKesson
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.organizations = ORGTERM1,ORGTERM2,ORGTERM3
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.sendingApplications = Hl7GatewayServer,InteleRis
com.intelerad.hl7gatewayserver.ordertermination.policy.OrderTerminationPolicySimpleModule.statusTerminal = CA

Notes

As part of this fix, please unblock this automated test: com.intelerad.integrationtesting.hl7gs.hl7.TestOrderTerminationAdHoc.includeOrExcludeBasedOnStringDates
item.summary: HL7GS Order Termination Fails at end of 31 day month with order with YYYYMM requested date time that should be excluded

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Changing the automation recipe's inclusive date range lower limit from 30 to 31 days should resolve the automation failure. Modifying the failing unit test in this fashion is the proof of concept that this will work.

Waiting on the Integrations team to confirm that this solution is acceptable to them.

This isn't so much a test failure as a test data failure. Where a day is omitted in a DT, deleting on the 31st of the month is not unreasonable. It's technically allowed by the HL7 standard but not really supported by our applications. 201901 is equally likely to represent Jan 1 as Jan 31. So on Jan 31 is could be anywhere from 0 to 31 days ago.

Such an order would not sort properly in IVWL, possibly be filtered out of ATC, will not show in DMWL, will most likely be ignored by Ris Prefetch and we would tell the RIS vendor to fix their broken feed if they sent one to us.

Working off the assumption that Alex is correct, which I believe is wise, the fix is the change a single line of automation recipe code.

Verifying that the fix works will be tricky because the test runner and the test server would need to be set to the 31st day of a 31 day month. We obviously won't have that opportunity in February. This will be the patch called "automation_recipe_fix.patch".

As, It involves more risk than the recipe change solution, Its collectively decided to go with recipe change.

item.title: [IP-97498] LDS does not run under a 64 bit JVM
item.description:
As part of the JDK 11 migration which is solely supports 64 bit versions, we need to fix the the LDS issues running the PACS on a 64bit JVM. This is what currently happens when we switch it to running a 64 bit 1.8 JVM.

Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: You have loaded library /usr/local/Intelerad/3rd_Party/lib/libjposix.so.1 which might have disabled stack guard. The VM will try to fix the stack guard now.
It's highly recommended that you fix the library with 'execstack -c <libfile>', or link it with '-z noexecstack'.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I tweaked scons to build the LDS jni within a 64 bit mode and I got the following scons error compiling the C code. This is far outside of my area of expertise. I talked to Luke de Gruchy that the backend team will need to take on this code change. I've attached the scons patch to get this error.

Seems like these errors break down as follows:

1) short c; and char c; declarations in PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h

PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h:78: error: conflicting declaration ‘char c’
PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h:77: error: ‘c’ has a previous declaration as ‘short int c’
PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h:100: error: redefinition of ‘short int c’
PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h:77: error: ‘short int c’ previously declared here
PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h:101: error: conflicting declaration ‘char c’
PACS/DICOM/CTNfacilities/dicom/dicom.h:77: error: ‘c’ has a previous declaration as ‘short int c’

The first problematic code block alluded to is here:

#if !defined(SHORTSIZE) || SHORTSIZE != 16
/* The writers of this code assume that shorts are 16 bits long.
** If that is not the case, this system will not operate properly.
** This code will trip the compiler.  This code also tripes the
** compiler if you have not defined the macro SHORTSIZE.  You
** also want to define INTSIZE and LONGSIZE.
*/

    short c;
    char c;			/* See note above */
#endif

The second is here:

#if LONGSIZE == 64 && INTSIZE == 32	/* Such as an Alpha */
    typedef unsigned int U32;
    typedef int S32;

#elif LONGSIZE == 32		/* Most 32 bit workstations */
    typedef unsigned long U32;
    typedef long S32;

#else				/* Something we do not support */

/* The writers of this code assume that we can find a 32 bit integer
** defined for this system as an int or a long.  If that assumption
** is not true, this code will not operate properly.
** This code will trip the compiler.
*/

    short c;
    char c;			/* See note above */

#endif

2) Use of the U32 type (I think it's a typedef for a 32 bit int?). It looks like all the compile errors are due to usages of U32.

Notes from a chat with Franklin Boumda Mouafo:

LDS uses C++ code in two places that I can think of:

  • a .so directly linked with the JVM
  • a .so linked with the Java validation program

Things to try (from easiest to hardest?):

  1. require that LDS run under a 32-bit JVM
  2. look for a way (StackOverflow, Google, ...) to link a 32-bit .so with a 64-bit JVM
  3. try compiling our C++ code as 64-bit (maybe just for LDS) & seeing if it works
  4. rewrite the necessary code in Java

The problems with compiling as 64-bit are:

  • it's likely that some of the C++ code is written assuming a 32-bit architecture (e.g. CTN library) and would fail at runtime (or quietly corrupt memory)
  • even if it were to compile and pass tests, how confident would be be that it really works in prod? (Remember that a segfault (for example) in native code will take out the entire JVM, not just the thread from which it was called. (At least in earlier JVMs.))

require that LDS run under a 32-bit JVM

There are no OpenJDK 11 32 bit JVM options, only 64 bit on Linux

look for a way (StackOverflow, Google, ...) to link a 32-bit .so with a 64-bit JVM

I've googled/played around with this as well, please feel free to perform your own research but everything I've come across is you need to match them on Linux JVM's

try compiling our C++ code as 64-bit (maybe just for LDS) & seeing if it works

This is what the attached patch should have been attempting to do. Just compile the JNI code for LDS in 64 bit mode.

rewrite the necessary code in Java

Please

Looked for all the native code in LDS:

$ find components/mudball/LocalDicomService/ -name "*.java" | xargs grep -l "public native"
components/mudball/LocalDicomService/src/main/java/com/intelerad/localdicomservice/validation/RisValidationCpp.java
components/mudball/LocalDicomService/src/main/java/com/intelerad/localdicomservice/common/CppUtilsDefault.java
So CppUtilsDefault seems to just have methods dealing with symlinks. Do the latest JDK File APIs cover these use cases? Probably.

So CppUtilsDefault seems to just have methods dealing with symlinks. Do the latest JDK File APIs cover these use cases? Probably.

Absolutely it does: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/links.html
Investigation complete

item.title: [IP-96232] intelebase: scons: Failure to rebuild python lib.zip after changes made to files included in externalpackages
item.description:
When having a scons file such at this for Support/Scripts:

[...]
'supportUtilities.lib.zip',
externalpackages=[('ims/listsupporttools','Support/Scripts/python'),
('ims/st','Support/Scripts/python'),
('ims/st/util','Support/Scripts/python')]

... making changes to files under Support/Scripts/python/ims/st/util, for example, does not trigger rebuilding of supportUtilities.lib.zip.

Note that this can occur for any such lib.zip, for example, Support/Tools/supportTools.lib.zip is also affected.
item.summary: intelebase: scons: Failure to rebuild python lib.zip after changes made to files included in externalpackages

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Just to be clear, the bug is externalpackages are not added as dependency to libfile in PythonScripts() in <intelebase repo>/python/ims/scons/misc.py.

So when John changed externalpackages <intelepacs repo>/Support/Scripts/python/ims/st/util/terminal.py, libfile <intelepacs repo>/Support/Scripts/supportUtilities.lib.zip is not rebuilt.

This basically broke our continuous build testing triggered by each push. This does not break full build (because all full builds start from scratch) so this do not impact our customers.
Current work-around is to manually delete Support/Scripts/supportUtilities.lib.zip on the build slave to force it to be rebuilt.

This causes the build to fail any time changes are made to unit tests for Support/Scripts (for example) which depend changes to the library code (supportUtilities.lib.zip) since the .zip doesn't get rebuilt. This caused a failure today:

scons: rebuilding `buildout/Support/Scripts/python/ims/dbgrow/test_dbgrower.stamp' because `Support/Scripts/python/ims/dbgrow/test_dbgrower.py' changed
[2017-02-17 08:06:31] run_and_touch(["buildout/Support/Scripts/python/ims/dbgrow/test_dbgrower.stamp"], ["Support/Scripts/python/ims/dbgrow/test_dbgrower.py", "Support/Scripts/supportUtilities.lib.zip"])
[2017-02-17 08:06:32] cd Support/Scripts/python/ims && /workerroot/scons2/build.scons-2/build.master.PACS-4-14-1/intelebase/bin/build/runPythonTests.py dbgrow/test_dbgrower.py && touch /workerroot/scons2/build.scons-2/build.master.PACS-4-14-1/buildout/Support/Scripts/python/ims/dbgrow/test_dbgrower.stamp PYTHONPATH=/tmp/pytestlib.QmRwdN/pytestlib:/workerroot/scons2/build.scons-2/build.master.PACS-4-14-1/Support/Scripts/python/ims/python:/workerroot/scons2/build.scons-2/build.master.PACS-4-14-1/intelebase/python:/workerroot/scons2/build.scons-2/build.master.PACS-4-14-1/buildout/lbe/lib/python2.6 /usr/bin/python2.6-intelerad dbgrow/test_dbgrower.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "dbgrow/test_dbgrower.py", line 11, in <module>
    from ims.st.testutil import stub
ImportError: cannot import name stub
runPythonTests.py: error: FAIL: ran 1 test script(s), 1 failed:
  dbgrow/test_dbgrower.py
scons: *** Error 1
scons: *** [buildout/Support/Scripts/python/ims/dbgrow/test_dbgrower.stamp] Error 1

This occurred because the stub.py module which was added by the changeset was not present in the supportUtilities.lib.zip, since the latter hadn't been rebuilt after the changes were made.

Hi, we've got the same issue (cf IP-95757)

It seems that the issue is there :

  • File: intelebase/python/ims/scons/misc.py
  • Function: _pythonlibrary

The variable externalsources is always empty because files provided by the code:

os.path.join(root, package.replace(".", "/"), "*.py")

are not found. For example, for Databases/Databases/DicomEvidence/dicomevidence.scons, the value is :

Databases/Databases/DicomEvidence/Scripts/python/ims/dicommaster/*.py

Files are not found because I guess the path is related to the top-level SConstruct, not the SConscript file.
I just added a "#" and it fixes the issue:

os.path.join('#', root, package.replace(".", "/"), "*.py")

Don't know if it is the right way to fix that (I'm not a scons expert), so not fixing it right now, but feel free to ask me info.

Exchanges with Peter Georgiakakis about the code change review :

When you add a # at the beginning of the path it tell scons that the path starts at the root where the SConstruct file exists.

Yes, and I checked that: each scons script that uses the "externalpackages" parameter are using a root path.
And now thinking about it looks logical because it is named "external"

Don't know if this is the correct behavior since it may pick up more files then you intend.

That's a very good point. But actually this variable is always empty!
Currently externalpackages is passed directly to the intelebase/bin/build/createPythonLib, so the whole package is already "scanned" and added to the zip file.
The loop with the Glob function seems to add only *.py scripts.
And I guess it is the purpose of the loop : add dependy to all the files that will be in the zip file.
Definitively I have to check all zip file before and after the fix.

did you track the places from where this misc.py file is accessed? Is this what is expected by that code.

Yes, I tracked all scons scripts that uses this "externalpackages" parameter (grep -r --include="*.scons" externalpackages).
On PACS/atlas/cds, there are 12 scons files.
I tested update one some files for some modules and I have the same behaviour : zip file is not updated. And with the fix, it is updated.
I added a trace to display the externalsources, it is always empty, and I don't think it is what it is expected.

could you instead prefix the # in the code that supplies the 'root' value?
I see that the function PythonScripts is defined on line 35 and it takes a parameter externalpackages. You should track the caller of that function and see about adding the # to the elements of that array instead.

I tried this solution.
It works perfectly for the loop that populates the externalsources.
But it causes the intelebase/bin/build/createPythonLib raising an error because it doesn't understand the # in the path...
I could remove the "#" before calling createPythonLib, but it looks a bit weird to me.
And with this solution, we will have to fix every scons file to add the #.

Tests to be done :
1. Prove that the change impact only to some scon files, so the fix will have no impact on other builds, and the test can focus on those scon files
2. Ensure that the change doesn't change zip files produced on every impacted scons module
3. As the change is in the intelebase "shared" repo, ensure that the change is backward compatible on all PACS version (especially older version than PACS-4-14-1)

1. Done

  • added the code 
    if not externalsources:
    raise Exception('externalsources not EMPTY!')

    at python/ims/scons/misc.py:124

  • run scons on the whole project.
    No exception => prove that the code that fills externalsources is never called

2. Done
Rebuilt modules that use the "externalpackages" parameter (or are dependant). Can be found with

grep -l -r --include="*.scons" externalpackages

The RPM produced without and with the fix are exactly the same.

RPM compare did with the tool pkgdiff :

# Copy RPM files (do it for old and new)
find . -name "*.rpm" | grep -v /RPMS/ | xargs cp -t ~/compare/new/

for i in ~/compare/new/*.rpm; do echo $i; base=`basename $i`; pkgdiff ~/compare/new/$base ~/compare/old/$base; done
# Extract percentage diff
grep -r -A 3 "lib.zip" pkgdiff_reports | grep value

No diff found (0 %).

item.title: [IP-104366] Ensure java11 PACS applications use service profiles for each Xmx
item.description:
Business Value:

  • Make sure that java 11 PACS applications consume appropriate memory

Acceptance Criteria

  • Modify all IntelePACS run scripts to use Service Profiles if they don't already
  • Add a single default Xms value of 64M to Service Profiles
  • Ensure every single IntelePACS run script uses the default Service Profiles Xms value
  • Ensure every single Atlas application (script?) uses the default Service Profiles Xms value
  • Migrate all hard-coded Xmx values from IntelePACS scripts to Service Profiles config values

Description:

  • Modify run_* scripts to add Xms and Xmx java options if they are not already setup
  • As a first step, force to use previous java8 default values for java11:
    JAVA 11
    InitialHeapSize 512M (RAM / 64)
    MaxHeapSize 8G (RAM / 4)
    JAVA 8
    InitialHeapSize 64M
    MaxHeapSize 1G

So, to be clear, if the following parameters are not set or the run script doesn't use service_profiles:

  • Xms = 64M
  • Xmx = 1G

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Any PACS java application has Xms and Xmx setup with the expected values when they are launched.

Technical Info

  • Service Profiles: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JsqITwiaMxV135BvMvd6Drdi5rRIcASvfcgmvOYauuE/edit#
  • JVM Ergonomics: https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/gctuning/ergonomics.html
  • This is the list of applications installed on dev-effectiveness that need to be added to ServiceProfiles:
    • PacsGlobals
    • AutoPull
    • UpdateMasterDb
    • BringOnlineQueueBuilder
    • SrsGuardian
    • DicomAgent
    • SeriesEditorDaemon
    • LocalAuditService
    • DicomRetrievalService
    • PostgresMonitor
    • PostgresIndexRebuilder
    • DicomMover
    • ReplicateUsersDB
    • ReplicateReportDistribution
    • WorkflowCacheService
    • ReplicateReportWorkflowDB
    • MultiMethodWorkflowService
    • ReportWorkflowService
    • IocmAgent
    • WorkflowQualityService
    • AnalyticsIntegrationServices
    • ImageStorageMonitor
    • StorageCommitmentHandler
    • Transfer2SSDB
    • DicomExternService
    • PrefetchQueueBuilder
    • ModalityWorklistGateway
    • ReplicateStudyClassifier
    • InteleBrowser-RisUpdater
  • These are the applications already on ServiceProfiles
    • All Atlas applications
    • Hl7FileSender
    • DicomMasterService
    • Hl7GatewayServer
    • LocalDicomService
    • WaveletServer
    • GenericUserObjectService
    • AuditTrailService
    • UserService
    • ReportDistributionDaemon
item.summary: Ensure java11 PACS applications use service profiles for each Xmx

comments.comment:
Ideally, every single application would have a service profile, but they don't.

Adding one service profile per app would too much work for this jira.

Adding a default service profile that all non-service profile apps would use would be bad design, since it would make it exceedingly difficult to change the memory profile of a single app should this be required in production.

Unfortunately, it looks like the best option is to hard code each Xmx and Xms for each app not on service profiles.

All IntelePACS applications that use service-profiles:

find /opt/intelerad/etc/service-profiles -name memory-size | xargs cat | awk -F @ '{print $1}' | awk '{print $1}' | sort -u | sed -s "s/.*\.//g"

Attached a patch with my work done so far (only for IntelePACS).

This will have to be done for Atlas as well.

Need to add new config keys for each app:

serviceProfile = </usr/local/tools/control_files/source/PACS.cfg:HOST_${long_localhost}:serviceProfile>

Several runscripts, including UMDB, have the main class in the jar manifest, and not the java command itself:

$JAVA_SYMLINK \
  -Xmx512m \
  -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow \
  $LOGMGR_CLASS \ -Dsun.net.http.retryPost=false \ -Djava.library.path=/usr/local/Intelerad/3rd_Party/lib:/usr/local/tools/lib \
  -jar $APP_JAR \
  "$@" >> $LOG_FILE 2>&1 < /dev/null &

cat MANIFEST.MF
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Created-By: Intelerad
Permissions: all-permissions
Main-Class: com.intelerad.umdb.UpdateMasterDbController

A better pattern for finding the main class for a particular application is to look into its scons file.

So, for UMDB, look in components/pacsapps/pacsapps.scons:

component.appjar(
    '#PACS/Databases/UpdateMasterDb/build/UpdateMasterDb.jar',
    ['com.intelerad.umdb.UpdateMasterDbController',
     'com.intelerad.datamodels.dicom.seriestypegenerator.seriesdescriptionexactmatch.SeriesDescBasedScannedDocComparatorModule',
     'com.intelerad.datamodels.dicom.seriestypegenerator.seriesdescriptionexactmatch.SeriesDescBasedScannedDocumentComparator',

This all has to be done very carefully because without a line in each service profile, the app in question will launch successfully with only 64m of max heap:

ps aux | grep PacsGlobals
/usr/local/tools/PacsGlobals/java_PacsGlobals -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -Xmx64m ...

ReplicateReportWorkflowDB is a bit of a special case as we need to run the following command with extra arguments:

/usr/local/tools/ReplicateReportWorkflowDB/java_ReplicateReportWorkflowDB -Xmx64m -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -jar /usr/local/tools/ReplicateReportWorkflowDB.jar -n com.intelerad.db.reportworkflowdb.replication.ReportWorkflowDbReplicationController

This doesn't seem to fit neatly within the service profiles framework. Either we find a clever workaround, leave it as is, or deal with it in another jira.
Added more patches including the incomplete replicatereportworkflow patch.
